required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Long-term Follow-up of HLH Patients Who Received Treatment With NI-0501, an Anti-interferon Gamma Monoclonal Antibody
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter Study for the Long-term Follow-up of HLH Patients Who Received Treatment With NI-0501, an Anti-interferon Gamma Monoclonal Antibody

brief_summary.textblock: International, multicenter, long-term, follow-up study that will enroll HLH patients who have received NI-0501 in a previous clinical trial, in the context of the clinical development program for NI-0501

detailed_description.textblock:
The aim of this study is to monitor the long-term safety profile of patients who have previously received at least one dose of NI-0501, including survival at several time points after the administration of NI-0501.
Moreover to study the elimination profile of NI-0501 and to assess the immunogenicity of NI-0501.
Furthermore in the event that patients, upon request of the treating physician, will be maintained on NI-0501 treatment beyond the foreseen 8 weeks, NI-0501 safety, tolerability, efficacy and PK profile will be closely monitored in these patients until treatment discontinuation.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 12 months post transplant or post last dose of NI-0501
primary_outcome.description: The incidence, intensity, possible relationship to NI-0501 and outcomes of adverse events, serious and non-serious, will be assessed throughout the study. Vital signs, physical examination and laboratory values: evolution over time.

other_outcome.time_frame: Pre transplant, 30, 60, 100 days and 6, 12 months post transplant or post last dose of NI-0501
Up to 6 months after last NI-0501 infusion
Up to 6 months after last NI-0501 infusion
other_outcome.description: IFNγ total, as long as NI-0501 can be measured IFNγ free, as soon as NI-0501 is not detectable Exploratory parameters/disease markers

other_outcome.time_frame: Up to 6 months after last NI-0501 infusion

arm_group.arm_group_label: NI-0501 only in case is requested
arm_group.description: NI-0501, in the event that, upon request of the treating physician, NI-0501 treatment needs to be prolonged beyond Week 8 foreseen in the previous protocol, patients will continue receiving NI-0501 in the context of this study.

intervention.description: In the event that NI-0501 treatment needs to be prolonged beyond Week 8 foreseen in the previous study, and upon request of the treating physician, patients will continue receiving NI-0501 in the context of this study.
intervention.arm_group_label: NI-0501 only in case is requested

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Having received at least one dose of NI-0501.
- Having signed the Informed Consent by the patient or the patient's legal representative(s), as applicable, with the assent of patients who are legally capable of providing it.
Exclusion Criteria:
- None

clinical_study.keyword: Hemophagocytic lymphohistiocytosis (HLH) previously treated with NI-0501
